Package com.intellij.openapi.roots

Class SyntheticLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.roots.SyntheticLibrary
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaSyntheticLibrary

    public abstract class SyntheticLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    A lightweight library definition comparing to Library. When provided by AdditionalLibraryRootsProvider, a library of this type contributes the followings:
    • Source libraries roots (getSourceRoots()) extend GlobalSearchScope.allScope(Project) (in UI, "Project and Libraries" scope). Files contained inside the returned roots are considered as library source files: ProjectFileIndex.isInLibrarySource(VirtualFile) returns true for them.
    • File exclusions for provided sources roots (getExcludedRoots()). These roots won't be indexed and will be handled as LibraryEx.getExcludedRoots()

      • Generally, getSourceRoots() are handled similarly to library.getFiles(OrderRootType.SOURCES).
    • An item in "External Libraries" in Project view if library returns true on isShowInExternalLibrariesNode() and is instance of ItemPresentation
      • .

    To decorate a child node of "External Libraries" node in Project view consider implementing corresponding interfaces:

    • ItemPresentation or ColoredItemPresentation
    • LocationPresentation
    • Navigatable or NavigatableWithText
    See Also:
    AdditionalLibraryRootsProvider

      • getExcludeFileCondition

        public Condition<VirtualFile> getExcludeFileCondition()
        Returns:
        a condition for excluding file from a library or null E.g. you can exclude all non-java file by returning file -> !file.getName().endsWith(".java")

        Excluding directory leads to excluding all its content recursively.

        NOTE: The condition is participating in building indexing and project model, it must be bloody fast in order not to affect overall IDE performance.

        NOTE 2: Try not to use file.getFileType() method since it might load file's content to know the type, which will try to load encoding and guess files project which is lead to SOE.

      • isShowInExternalLibrariesNode

        public boolean isShowInExternalLibrariesNode()

      • equals

        public abstract boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        This method is vital if this library is shown under "External Libraries" (the library should implement ItemPresentation for that). In this case, each ExternalLibrariesNode.getChildren() invocation will create a new SyntheticLibraryElementNode instance passing this library as a value. In order to figure out if "External Library" children are updated or not, AbstractTreeUi uses node's equals/hashCode methods which in turn depend on this library's equals/hashCode methods: see AbstractTreeNode.hashCode().

        Please make sure that two SyntheticLibrary instances are equal if they reference the same state. Otherwise, constant UI updates will degrade performance. Consider implementing a better equals/hashCode if needed or instantiate SyntheticLibrary only if state changed (use some caching in AdditionalLibraryRootsProvider.getAdditionalProjectLibraries(Project)).

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
